intro: Epilobium hakkodense, commonly known as the Hakkodé willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Epilobium hakkodense is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
